programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys want to revive the long-neglected '71 240Z and drive it to SEMA.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Mike and Tony divert from a road trip to accept a drag racing challenge.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Mike and David buy each other their worst automotive nightmares and put them to the test against Steve in a showdown; Finnegan rides high, Freiburger works through some "cosmetic" damage and Dulcich rampages through fire.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The T-Bizzle is an '86 Thunderbird powered by a 302 V8, topped with a 6-71 blower and welded gears; Freiburger and Finnegan take it across the frozen tundra of the northern U.S., on a classic road trip with plenty of fail.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan take a look at Roadkill's Top Project Cars.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan clean out wheels that have been stashed in the garage for far too long by slapping them on a neglected '66 Dodge D100 Utiline truck; they hit the road on a quest to find the perfect 440 for it.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys scrounge their parts piles and come up with impressive results.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich settle who has the better cheap 4x4.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys have a build off and race like no other; Tony transforms a shell of an '85 Monte Carlo into a beast, while Finnegan makes Newbern's Nova run with ramp truck parts; it's three days of wrenching, two tracks and one unbelievable race.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern rescue an '67 Firebird that has been stowed in a barn.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich hit the road in the '68 Wreck Runner, a four-speed, 383ci clone made from the scraps of a '68 Road Runner and a '68 Satellite; it only has a few little issues; they hit the road to sort 'em out.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern take the barn-find '67 Firebird on an 800 mile road trip to race Freiburger and Dulcich in the Crusher Camaro.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan take on Dulcich and Newbern in a circle-track car shootout.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys rediscover and road trip the 1971 Chrysler eight-door airport car.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys take a road trip to Florida in an oil-guzzling '74 Toyota Hilux.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys acquire an awesome '70s Mullholland-racer-inspired Camaro.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys take the Rotsun, Nascarlo and Super Camaro to Laguna Seca Raceway.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys ride high as they test the Bubble on the dragstrip and off-road.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys deploy the Muscle Truck in the pits of a drag boat race.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys figure out how to stuff a 426ci Hemi into their 1975 AMC Gremlin.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys finish up The Hemi Gremmie and take it for its first road test.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys buy a sight-unseen '56 Nash stretched over a Toyota truck chassis.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Tony Angelo take the world's worst '68 to a whole new level!

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: At Roadkill Nights, the guys take a clean Duster and trade down each day.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The Rubber Duck Firebird goes on a 1,000-mile drag racing road trip.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The General Mayhem and the Death Metal Charger road trip to DirtFish.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys road trip a big-block 1980 Dodge Mirada to Du Quoin, Illinois.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys road trip two beaters to a deserted factory for a winter battle.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys' attempt at a Hemi Gremmie road trip is foiled by engine trouble.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan buy an '86 Trans Am and take it for its first road test on the drag-and-drive event Sick Week; with a swapped 350 V8 and a six-speed, the big question is whether they be able to make it faster each day or even finish the race.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Freiburger attempt to get a bucket-list '66 Corvette -- abandoned halfway through an LS swap and restoration -- back on the road. With multiple iterations and attempts, the 'Vette hasn't been on the road for 30 years. Will they change that?

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern light the tires as they road test their LS-powered '66 C2 Corvette from Oakland to Las Vegas with the smokiest burnouts ever. Follow along as they blaze the coast and hit the drag strip with Dulcich before breaking down in Sin City.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Steve finds a '71 Pontiac T-37 at a junkyard in Idaho; Mike and David take their time reviving a motor that's been sitting for 38 years.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern give new life to a '57 Chevy Bel Air that was pulled from a junkyard after more than 30 years. The guys drop in a small-block V8 and turbo 350 to get the car back on the pavement for a bumpy road trip back to where it came from.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan meet up with Derek Bieri to take a 1968 big-block Dart on a tire-smoking road trip, which includes a final run down Memphis International Raceway and some high-speed passes down George Ray's Wildcat Dragstrip.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern revive the '73 Chevy Ramp Truck.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan surprises Freiburger by fixing up the Gremmie for Roadkill Nights.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: A road trip keeps Freiburger distracted prior to the Hemi Gremmie surprise.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan drive the Hemi Gremmie from Detroit to St. Louis.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The new look for the Crusher is inspired by early 1970s NHRA Modified Production drag cars; the transformation of a BluePrint Engines 400ci small-block Chevy.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David fixes up Steve's never-driven 1973 Dodge 100 to finally get his beloved muscle truck out on the road.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Crusher Camaro gets its eighth engine in its 23rd year as a project car; Steve Dulcich and David Freiburger install the engine along with a TH350 transmission.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich hack the sheet metal off of a 1970 Dodge Challenger to fit giant off-road tires and go desert-bashing.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Steve Dulcich gears up and attacks David Freiburger's 1970 Plymouth known as the Crop Duster.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger heads well outside the garage and into the outback of Colorado to revive a '68 Jeep Wagoneer that was untouched for 22 years; he gets help from special guest host Rick Pewe, editor of Jp Magazine.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger's 1967 Chevy, the Crusher Camaro, is one of the industry's best-known project cars; this changeling is getting its latest makeover on Roadkill Garage, and the retro revival wraps up with a trip to the drag strip.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Dulcich D100 is back; after a couple of engines, Steve Dulcich and David Freiburger install a fresh, 550hp, 408ci engine in the Mopar Muscle Truck.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Steve and David work on fixing an aftermarket fuel injection on a Ford muscle truck.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Cougar and the gear-banging are back, but the car now belongs to Steve Dulcich, and the guys are jerking the haggard Cleveland in favor of a 450hp, 363ci, Windsor-based stroker small-block.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David and Steve have a great time fixing the Crusher Impala and testing it with 100-yard burnouts.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The beloved Crew Cab Chevelle is back and the guys want to find out how fast this old four-door vehicle can go in a standing mile.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich have a new project car, a quick and dirty 1940 Ford Fordor; the guys decide to beef it up with some new heads, a new carb and a supercharger.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger's wild scheme for pick-up truck greatness begins with a grandpa-fresh long bed and a high horsepower engine after he picks up two vintage Chevy C10 pick-up trucks.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger scores a 1968 Chrysler Town and Country wagon for $1,800, and with its 440ci big-block for power, it's soon dubbed the Gargantuwagon; Freiburger and Steve Dulcich show how to give any old car a once-over.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger scores a 1965 Ford F-250 4x4 like one he used to own and comes up with a plan.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Steve Dulcich had big dreams for his 1968 Plymouth Barracuda before it burned to the ground in the California wildfires; Dulcich was devastated, and his buddy David Freiburger decided they needed to make the car live again.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich demonstrate how to get big-block power for cheap by choosing a non-mainstream engine.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Steve Dulcich and David Freiburger put 650 horsepower from a Ford Cleveland engine in a Jeep Commando, starting the Clevo Commando project.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Ford Muscle Truck; the guys take a break to look at progress on the Disgustang 1969 Mach 1 and wrap with a new-to-them Pro Street FoMoCo project car.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Vanishing Paint 1970 Dodge Challenger gathered dust for months, but now the guys need to fix it in time for a Tire Rack race.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich show how to install a ProCharger centrifugal supercharger on any carbureted V-8; this one happens to be the bone-stock 350ci small-block in the 1967 Chevy C10 shortbed.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich are back with the 1970 Dodge Challenger known as Vanishing Paint; they install a homegrown package of average-guy suspension add-ons for cornering performance.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich teach the ins and outs of a nitrous installation.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Steve Dulcich show off their new project car: a Model A on '32 Ford rails.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David and Steve nab a '56 Chevy 210 that was once an NHRA champion.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Steve finally convinces David to work on a boat that uses a Chrysler V8.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys make some progress marrying a Cleveland engine to a Jeep Commando.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys want to revive the long-neglected '71 240Z and drive it to SEMA.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Mike and Tony divert from a road trip to accept a drag racing challenge.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Mike and David buy each other their worst automotive nightmares and put them to the test against Steve in a showdown; Finnegan rides high, Freiburger works through some "cosmetic" damage and Dulcich rampages through fire.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The T-Bizzle is an '86 Thunderbird powered by a 302 V8, topped with a 6-71 blower and welded gears; Freiburger and Finnegan take it across the frozen tundra of the northern U.S., on a classic road trip with plenty of fail.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan take a look at Roadkill's Top Project Cars.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan clean out wheels that have been stashed in the garage for far too long by slapping them on a neglected '66 Dodge D100 Utiline truck; they hit the road on a quest to find the perfect 440 for it.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys scrounge their parts piles and come up with impressive results.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich settle who has the better cheap 4x4.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys have a build off and race like no other; Tony transforms a shell of an '85 Monte Carlo into a beast, while Finnegan makes Newbern's Nova run with ramp truck parts; it's three days of wrenching, two tracks and one unbelievable race.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern rescue an '67 Firebird that has been stowed in a barn.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich hit the road in the '68 Wreck Runner, a four-speed, 383ci clone made from the scraps of a '68 Road Runner and a '68 Satellite; it only has a few little issues; they hit the road to sort 'em out.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern take the barn-find '67 Firebird on an 800 mile road trip to race Freiburger and Dulcich in the Crusher Camaro.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan take on Dulcich and Newbern in a circle-track car shootout.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys rediscover and road trip the 1971 Chrysler eight-door airport car.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys take a road trip to Florida in an oil-guzzling '74 Toyota Hilux.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys acquire an awesome '70s Mullholland-racer-inspired Camaro.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys take the Rotsun, Nascarlo and Super Camaro to Laguna Seca Raceway.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys ride high as they test the Bubble on the dragstrip and off-road.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys deploy the Muscle Truck in the pits of a drag boat race.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys figure out how to stuff a 426ci Hemi into their 1975 AMC Gremlin.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys finish up The Hemi Gremmie and take it for its first road test.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys buy a sight-unseen '56 Nash stretched over a Toyota truck chassis.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Tony Angelo take the world's worst '68 to a whole new level!

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: At Roadkill Nights, the guys take a clean Duster and trade down each day.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The Rubber Duck Firebird goes on a 1,000-mile drag racing road trip.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The General Mayhem and the Death Metal Charger road trip to DirtFish.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys road trip a big-block 1980 Dodge Mirada to Du Quoin, Illinois.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys road trip two beaters to a deserted factory for a winter battle.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys' attempt at a Hemi Gremmie road trip is foiled by engine trouble.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan buy an '86 Trans Am and take it for its first road test on the drag-and-drive event Sick Week; with a swapped 350 V8 and a six-speed, the big question is whether they be able to make it faster each day or even finish the race.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Freiburger attempt to get a bucket-list '66 Corvette -- abandoned halfway through an LS swap and restoration -- back on the road. With multiple iterations and attempts, the 'Vette hasn't been on the road for 30 years. Will they change that?

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern light the tires as they road test their LS-powered '66 C2 Corvette from Oakland to Las Vegas with the smokiest burnouts ever. Follow along as they blaze the coast and hit the drag strip with Dulcich before breaking down in Sin City.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Steve finds a '71 Pontiac T-37 at a junkyard in Idaho; Mike and David take their time reviving a motor that's been sitting for 38 years.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern give new life to a '57 Chevy Bel Air that was pulled from a junkyard after more than 30 years. The guys drop in a small-block V8 and turbo 350 to get the car back on the pavement for a bumpy road trip back to where it came from.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan meet up with Derek Bieri to take a 1968 big-block Dart on a tire-smoking road trip, which includes a final run down Memphis International Raceway and some high-speed passes down George Ray's Wildcat Dragstrip.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern revive the '73 Chevy Ramp Truck.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan surprises Freiburger by fixing up the Gremmie for Roadkill Nights.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: A road trip keeps Freiburger distracted prior to the Hemi Gremmie surprise.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan drive the Hemi Gremmie from Detroit to St. Louis.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The new look for the Crusher is inspired by early 1970s NHRA Modified Production drag cars; the transformation of a BluePrint Engines 400ci small-block Chevy.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David fixes up Steve's never-driven 1973 Dodge 100 to finally get his beloved muscle truck out on the road.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Crusher Camaro gets its eighth engine in its 23rd year as a project car; Steve Dulcich and David Freiburger install the engine along with a TH350 transmission.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich hack the sheet metal off of a 1970 Dodge Challenger to fit giant off-road tires and go desert-bashing.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Steve Dulcich gears up and attacks David Freiburger's 1970 Plymouth known as the Crop Duster.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger heads well outside the garage and into the outback of Colorado to revive a '68 Jeep Wagoneer that was untouched for 22 years; he gets help from special guest host Rick Pewe, editor of Jp Magazine.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger's 1967 Chevy, the Crusher Camaro, is one of the industry's best-known project cars; this changeling is getting its latest makeover on Roadkill Garage, and the retro revival wraps up with a trip to the drag strip.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Dulcich D100 is back; after a couple of engines, Steve Dulcich and David Freiburger install a fresh, 550hp, 408ci engine in the Mopar Muscle Truck.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Steve and David work on fixing an aftermarket fuel injection on a Ford muscle truck.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Cougar and the gear-banging are back, but the car now belongs to Steve Dulcich, and the guys are jerking the haggard Cleveland in favor of a 450hp, 363ci, Windsor-based stroker small-block.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David and Steve have a great time fixing the Crusher Impala and testing it with 100-yard burnouts.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The beloved Crew Cab Chevelle is back and the guys want to find out how fast this old four-door vehicle can go in a standing mile.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich have a new project car, a quick and dirty 1940 Ford Fordor; the guys decide to beef it up with some new heads, a new carb and a supercharger.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger's wild scheme for pick-up truck greatness begins with a grandpa-fresh long bed and a high horsepower engine after he picks up two vintage Chevy C10 pick-up trucks.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger scores a 1968 Chrysler Town and Country wagon for $1,800, and with its 440ci big-block for power, it's soon dubbed the Gargantuwagon; Freiburger and Steve Dulcich show how to give any old car a once-over.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger scores a 1965 Ford F-250 4x4 like one he used to own and comes up with a plan.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Steve Dulcich had big dreams for his 1968 Plymouth Barracuda before it burned to the ground in the California wildfires; Dulcich was devastated, and his buddy David Freiburger decided they needed to make the car live again.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich demonstrate how to get big-block power for cheap by choosing a non-mainstream engine.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Steve Dulcich and David Freiburger put 650 horsepower from a Ford Cleveland engine in a Jeep Commando, starting the Clevo Commando project.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Ford Muscle Truck; the guys take a break to look at progress on the Disgustang 1969 Mach 1 and wrap with a new-to-them Pro Street FoMoCo project car.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Vanishing Paint 1970 Dodge Challenger gathered dust for months, but now the guys need to fix it in time for a Tire Rack race.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich show how to install a ProCharger centrifugal supercharger on any carbureted V-8; this one happens to be the bone-stock 350ci small-block in the 1967 Chevy C10 shortbed.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich are back with the 1970 Dodge Challenger known as Vanishing Paint; they install a homegrown package of average-guy suspension add-ons for cornering performance.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich teach the ins and outs of a nitrous installation.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Steve Dulcich show off their new project car: a Model A on '32 Ford rails.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David and Steve nab a '56 Chevy 210 that was once an NHRA champion.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Steve finally convinces David to work on a boat that uses a Chrysler V8.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys make some progress marrying a Cleveland engine to a Jeep Commando.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today's case involves a Samoan so Dog knows that the runner's close-knit kinfolk hold the keys to bringing him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Once a criminal himself, Dog knows how it feels to be hunted. In this episode of our series that focuses on the tumultuous home and professional life of bounty hunter Dwayne "Dog" Chapman.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has only a few days to catch a woman nicknamed Cats or forfeit Beth's $10,000 bond. But it won't be easy - Cats is eight months pregnant, so Dog will have to lure her in rather than risk a violent grab.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is in for a big surprise after he catches a fugitive named Jonaven in a sting operation. In a teary heart-to-heart talk, Dog finds out that Jonaven's father was killed in a shoot-out with police when Jonaven was only 9. Dog then

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This fugitive's sketchy associates and footloose ways spell trouble for Dog in today's hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: So what does a bondsman do when he learns that the felon he's bonded out is booked on an afternoon flight to Florida? Especially when over $140,000 is at stake? If you're Dog, you 911 the team and race to Honolulu International.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's time is running out in Colorado. After a month of helping his bail bondsmen friends around Denver, he's got to get his family back home to Hawaii. But Dog wants one more capture before they leave.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and his team are out to revoke bail on Eugene, a chronic heroin addict. They find him in a squalid apartment with a huge stockpile of syringes, and they can see that his physical condition is deteriorating.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The boys get distracted by the bikini-clad lovelies on Waikiki when they hunt for Lucy, a homeless, alcoholic fugitive. Beth is amused by the boys, but this is serious business: Tim will have to pay the bond if Lucy isn't caught.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the family visit the Rockies for a little work and lot of fun.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog faces a tough personal and professional situation when he must hunt down his friend, Ili, who has helped him on many busts. But now Ili's on the other side of the law. She's didn't come to court to answer charges that

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: They say you can't teach an old dog new tricks, but what if it's The Dog doing the teaching? Today's target is wanted on domestic abuse charges, but when Dog discovers she works for an escort service he opts for a new twist on an old ruse.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has dropped Duane Lee from the team, and Leland is feeling caught in the middle. When Leland confronts Dog and Beth about the decision tempers flare.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has problems when he goes to a small town on the Big Island of Hawaii to track down a fugitive. In a small town, everyone knows everyone else's business, making it impossible for Dog to hunt in secret.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog, taking the day off to try his hand at coaching, assigns Tim and Leland to track down Emmanuel, a fugitive with terminal cancer who's got nothing to lose by running. Can the boys prove to Dog and Beth that they can handle a difficult job on their own?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Two different young men; one has a taste for larceny, the other for strong sprits, both have a bad bad habit of missing their court dates.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This one is close to home. Dog's target on today's hunt is the cousin of Kali, Garry Boy's caregiver. In addition she has a reputation as a brawler. With Duane Lee still missing from the team Baby Lyssa decides she will step-up in this hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: In a last ditch attempt to bring the team back together, Dog recruits his pastor, Tim Storey, to be the peacemaker.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and his team return to their roots, with a visit to their home town of Denver, Colorado. Dog and Tim begin the day with an early morning radio show appearance, and it pays off.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team search for Jonah, a violent and desperate criminal facing 20 years in jail. The trail goes stale when Dog runs into evasive family members and an angry girlfriend.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Duane Lee can't agree about what role Duane Lee should have in the family business, and the simmering tensions come to a head when Duane Lee is accused of denting Dog's SUV.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Upset because one his puppies may die and wanting to give the little guy a second chance in life, Dog decides to offer one of the fugitives a second chance, too.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is in Colorado helping a fellow bondsmen clean up his files. The target today has a history of violence, and apparently plans to re-locate without notifying the proper authorities.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With Duane Lee back on the team, the rift in the Chapman clan appears over. But will time heal this wound or make it worse?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It takes years to become a seasoned bondsman, and the tenderfoot Alysin has a lot to learn. She not only bailed out a man facing charges of theft on just his promise to pay the fee but also without a co-signer for his bond.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog juggles his job and family responsibilities at the same time. He leads the search for Robert, a low-level drug dealer who makes money by selling hedge clippings as marijuana and broken Macadamia nuts as crack.

programme.title: The Voyager with Josh Garcia
programme.desc: Upon docking in Rotterdam, Netherlands, Josh takes a tour to learn the importance of this old harbor city.

programme.title: The Voyager with Josh Garcia
programme.desc: Josh sails to Aruba where he is excited to explore the island and its interesting culture and history.

programme.title: The Voyager with Josh Garcia
programme.desc: After arriving in Girona, Josh heads for the Catalan countryside to learn about mar y montaña.

programme.title: The Voyager with Josh Garcia
programme.desc: Naples, Italy. Josh learns a traditional dance that for centuries was used as a remedy for sickness.

programme.title: The Voyager with Josh Garcia
programme.desc: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. Josh visits a skilled artisan who crafts handmade pieces through bronze casting.

programme.title: The Voyager with Josh Garcia
programme.desc: Shanghai, China. Josh learns the ancient martial art of tai chi and then discovers how to make soup dumplings.

programme.title: The Voyager with Josh Garcia
programme.desc: Athens, Greece. Josh learns how traditional prayer beads have become into a popular part of Greek culture.

programme.title: The Voyager with Josh Garcia
programme.desc: Josh sails to St. Petersburg, Russia, and immerses himself in the local culture.

programme.title: The Voyager with Josh Garcia
programme.desc: Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Josh discovers Brazil’s vast array of exotic fruit.

programme.title: The Voyager with Josh Garcia
programme.desc: Hong Kong. Josh visits the port of Hong Kong where a local foodie takes him on an unforgettable tour.

programme.title: The Voyager with Josh Garcia
programme.desc: Sydney, Australia. Josh surveys the coastal landscape and learns that “shrimp on the barbie” is a real thing.

programme.title: The Voyager with Josh Garcia
programme.desc: Merida, Mexico. Josh sees a Mayan chocolate ceremony, learns about henequen production, and more.

programme.title: The Voyager with Josh Garcia
programme.desc: Singapore. At a floating restaurant, Josh takes on a spicy national dish called Chili Crab.

programme.title: The Voyager with Josh Garcia
programme.desc: Josh sets off to explore Malaysia’s capital, the bustling city of Kuala Lumpur.

programme.title: The Voyager with Josh Garcia
programme.desc: Valladolid, Mexico. Josh learns the Jarana, tastes the ultimate local dish of cochinitap, and more.

programme.title: The Voyager with Josh Garcia
programme.desc: Dubrovnik, Croatia. Josh ventures into the turquoise waters of the Adriatic.

programme.title: The Voyager with Josh Garcia
programme.desc: Josh voyages to the island country of Malta, where his ship docks in the beautiful capital of Valletta.

programme.title: The Voyager with Josh Garcia
programme.desc: Josh sails to Tallinn, Estonia, one of Europe’s best-preserved cities, and steps back into medieval times.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: The courtroom erupts into chaos during a hearing for a murder case; the judge chastises a defendant for making horrible decisions; a prosecutor strongly disagrees with what he feels is an unreasonable sentence from the judge.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: A defendant who curses and flips his middle finger at the judge is held in contempt; an attorney who specializes in sexual battery cases pleads not guilty to sexual battery; a police officer forgives the man who plead guilty to firing shots at him.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: The judge moves a probation review to her courtroom after the defendant appears drunk for his virtual hearing; a defendant gets thrown out of the courtroom after talking back to the judge.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: A man convicted of double murder elbows his own attorney in the face; a defendant misses his virtual hearing by falling asleep; the judge loses his patience during a tenant/landlord dispute; and more.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: A man convicted of murdering his five-year-old son makes a scene in the courtroom; a convicted killer won't stay in his seat during his virtual sentencing; a man in court for allegedly violating his parole is held without bond.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: A judge gets creative for the sentencing of a woman who threw her food at a restaurant employee; a teacher accused of being drunk at school is arrested for public intoxication at her plea hearing; an accused stalker screams and swears at the judge.

programme.title: Court Cam

programme.title: World's Most Evil Prisoners
programme.desc: The story of Tyler Davis Bingham, pretty criminal turned leader of the brutal and feared Aryan Brotherhood.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Prisoners
programme.desc: While on trial for rape, 33-year-old Brian Nichols goes on a violent rampage that results in three murders.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Prisoners

programme.title: World's Most Evil Prisoners

programme.title: World's Most Evil Prisoners
programme.desc: Imprisoned for murdering a woman and her teenaged son, Denver Simmons only caused more violence behind bars.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Sarah Williams and Katrina Walsh, the two friends carry out the jealousy-fuelled murder of Sadie Hartley.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Richard Kuklinski claims to have murdered over 100 people for New York and New Jersey's crime families.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Jordan Monaghan kills his 24-day-old daughter Ruby on New Year's Day in January 2013.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1988, new light was shed on the mysterious death of a South Carolina farmer when a criminal confessed that two prominent community members hired him to commit murder. Local police and FBI agents arrested a wealthy businessman and later learned that, even behind bars, he commanded the power to corrupt and kill. Using prison informants, agents had to prevent him from murdering again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1980s, the drug trade ravages Chicago's inner city neighborhoods and violent crime threatens to destroy entire communities. As drug profits grow, gangs rule the streets. One of the most dangerous is the El Rukns. FBI Agents team up with state and local police to bring them down, but in the process, uncover a bizarre and frightening terrorist plot.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In September 1997, a team of masked gunmen robbed an armored car facility in Los Angeles, and made off with $18.9 million, the largest takeover heist in U.S. history. An employee believed she recognized the voice of one of the robbers, and FBI agents began conducting surveillance on a former employee of the facility. With only one piece of physical evidence, a fragment of a vehicle taillight, authorities hoped to connect him to the crime, and locate his accomplices.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, violent militants are intent on turning the US Commonwealth into a communist dictatorship. They murder a policeman, turns their guns on a busload of unarmed Navy workers, and even launch an attack on the FBI. These ruthless killers have vowed to fight to the death. The FBI must use every tactic at their disposal to track down the terrorists and bring them to justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Georgia, a series of bizarre shootings terrorizes the town of East Point. Two people are killed, and two are critically wounded. At first the shootings seem targeted, then they seem random. As the body count climbs, the killer taunts law enforcement with mysterious notes. Agents believe the shooter will continue until he is deador behind bars.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On December 21, 1998, two gunmen kidnap three janitors on their way to clean the Bank of America ATM repository in Las Vegas. The gunmen force the janitors to let them in the ATM repository and hold them hostage until the armored car guards arrive to make their nightly collection. When the guards enter the bank, the gunmen surprise them and shoot one guard in the chest before escaping with $1,088,000, the largest bank robbery take in Las Vegas history.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1996, a group of political extremists twice robbed a bank in Spokane, Washington, using homemade bombs and military precision to escape. The FBI learned that the robbers, part of a shadowy organization called the Phineas Priesthood, might be preparing for a small-scale war with law enforcement. After the suspects were identified, the FBI was faced with the task of safely arresting a group of terrorists with a deadly agenda.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On the day before Thanksgiving, a mother discovered her 10 year-old son was missing from his school. No one knew how it could have happened. Within hours, the boy's entire family was frantically searching for him. The few leads in the case quickly turned cold and the FBI was called in to aid in the investigation. The search by agents and local authorities would cover a thousand miles to expose the kidnapper and find the missing child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Kokomo, Indiana an unthinkable crime terrified residents. A young woman was snatched from her home on a bright spring morning. Drops of blood and a torn window screen were all that was left to tell authorities what happened to the twenty-one year old victim. After several days of searching, a former FBI profiler narrowed the suspect list to one. Agents and detectives followed the trail across state lines hoping to find the victim before her time ran out.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 90s, a gang based in the U.S. Virgin Islands began smuggling thousands of kilos of cocaine into mainland America. Police and federal agents target the gang, but its leader remains a mystery. In an investigation spanning from Georgia to South America, local police, the DEA, U.S. Customs and the FBI work together to take down this dangerous drug gang.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Philadelphia, a ruthless grab for power leads to a full-scale mob war. The local Mafia crime family splits in two as the young and the old fight to the death. The FBI is caught in the middle as they infiltrate the syndicate through informants and high-tech surveillance. Agents must find a way to bring down the organization before their civil war leads to innocent causalities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the winter of 2001, two well-loved and respected college professors are found murdered in their home. Nothing about the case makes sense. No items are missing from the home and the couple had no known enemies. Local police and FBI agents form a task force to find a pair of homegrown killers and a motive for the brutal crime they committed.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A man is found suffocated in his Pennsylvania home, his checkbook, credit cards and vehicle appear to have been stolen. Fingerprints from the victim identify a recent escapee from a minimum-security prison, as well as his girlfriend. Investigators flag the dead man's credit cards, and are alerted when one is used in North Dakota. The FBI is called in and joins another task force already assembled because of a suspected kidnapping.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1986, a small crime free Indiana town was turned inside out by the arrival of one dangerous stranger. After an officer was gunned down at point-blank range, the psychotic killer led investigators across the Midwest. No one knew where the gunman would strike next, even as his tally of murders and abductions grew. The FBI and state police raced against time to rescue America's heartland from this deranged gunman, before he killed again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1980, extortionists plant a thousand pound bomb in a Nevada casino and demand millions of dollars, or they will detonate the device. The bomb is the largest explosive device the FBI has ever seen. Detonation would be a disaster. Agents and bomb experts must disarm the deadly device, and stop the dangerous extortionist who built it.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1988, new light was shed on the mysterious death of a South Carolina farmer when a criminal confessed that two prominent community members hired him to commit murder. Local police and FBI agents arrested a wealthy businessman and later learned that, even behind bars, he commanded the power to corrupt and kill. Using prison informants, agents had to prevent him from murdering again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June 1973, a young girl was abducted from a state park on the Missouri River while camping with her family. Several months passed with no leads, then an FBI agent took a particular interest in the case. Using a new technique known as criminal profiling, he predicted that the kidnapper would contact the girl's family on the one-year anniversary of her abduction. When this prediction came true, the FBI agent noted behavioral clues, hoping that they could lead him to the kidnapper.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In January 1984, a U.S. Customs official disappears from his post near the Del Rio, Texas border crossing, prompting local police to search for four Latin American suspects driving a Pontiac Grand Prix. The following day, the Customs official was found dead. Two state troopers recovered the missing officer's service revolver after a fatal altercation with two men. Local police and the FBI continued searching for the suspect vehicle, prepared for a confrontation with desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1992, a young mother was gunned down in front of her children. Police searched for answers, but found none. The horrible crime appeared unmotivated, senseless, and random. Then, family members offered a startling clue. The victim, the wife of a prominent Atlanta attorney, was also a woman burdened with a secret; a secret the FBI believed led to her death. It would force local and federal agents to untangle an intricate web of money, drugs and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In August 1992, a man returned to his Memphis home and discovered that his wife was missing. The husband, as well as his friends, family and neighbors began to receive ransom calls. FBI agents noticed that one neighbor seemed to have the best rapport with the kidnapper. They began to question his level of involvement, but had to proceed carefully, knowing that he could be their only link to the missing woman.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1999, Police investigate two brutal murders in two small towns located hundreds of miles apart. The crimes seem random and unrelated, until investigators discover a terrifying link. Local police and the FBI must untangle a web of liesto stop a dangerous gang that will kill a man for his Identity.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In July 1997, a triple murder terrified residents in the nation's capital. In a Georgetown coffee shop, three employees were shot to death. Investigators could find no immediate suspects and no clear motive for the attack. Evidence at the crime scene pointed in many different directions. Was this a hate crime, a robbery gone wrong, or an act of cold-blooded vengeance against one of the victims?

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: This is the story of the FBI's first capture of an international Lebanese terrorist. In June 1985, the terrorist and his four accomplices hijacked Royal Jordanian flight #405 shortly before take off in Beirut, Lebanon. On board were American citizens, a professor and his teen son. The FBI opened a criminal investigation and worked with various other government agencies to form Operation Goldenrod, a task force specifically charged with bringing the terrorist to justice in 1989.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Four inmates from a Delaware Correctional Center turn up missing in the middle of the night. A few hours later, a stolen vehicle is recovered; inside, one of the inmate's fingerprints is found, as well as the address book of one of the other fugitives. A multi-state manhunt ensues with the help of the FBI. A nearby robbery report is the agent's first tip, followed by a murder in the same neighborhood.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 12, 1997, two men use a sledgehammer to break into a Camden, NJ home. The homeowner shoots at the intruders, hitting one in the hand before they escape. Camden Police respond and track the suspects to a nearby park. One of the men shoots at the officer before police arrest his accomplice. The man gives up the identity of the shooter. Twice, police stake out homes where they believe the shooter is hiding, but he eludes them.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 80's, Florida's cocaine imports were among the highest in the nation. Regional territories were enforced with intimidation and murder. Desperate to stop the violence, local authorities turned to the FBI for help. One dealer bowed to no one. He would stop at nothing to keep detectives and agents from building a case against him. When his organization began targeting the government itself, a city went on high alert.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A California bank manager panics and calls in the FBI after the door to his vault refuses to open. Upon inspection, the vault has been blasted into from the ceiling, and over $2 million in valuables is gone. When agents find no clues as to the robbers or their whereabouts in California, they send details of the crime to other FBI field offices. It is not long before agents in Ohio are investigating a bank vault robbery that is strikingly similar to the California heist.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: This is the story of the FBI's first capture of an international Lebanese terrorist. In June 1985, the terrorist and his four accomplices hijacked Royal Jordanian flight #405 shortly before take off in Beirut, Lebanon. On board were American citizens, a professor and his teen son. The FBI opened a criminal investigation and worked with various other government agencies to form Operation Goldenrod, a task force specifically charged with bringing the terrorist to justice in 1989.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Amid the cocaine wars of early 1980's Miami, three dead bodies led a multi-agency tactical squad to suspect that a group of cops might be involved in illegal drug busts. Investigating rumors of corruption, the squad uncovered a ring of patrolmen who were making millions by ripping off smuggled cocaine. The investigators set out to prove that even with the advantages wealth and the protection of a police badge, nobody is above the law.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 12, 1997, two men use a sledgehammer to break into a Camden, NJ home. The homeowner shoots at the intruders, hitting one in the hand before they escape. Camden Police respond and track the suspects to a nearby park. One of the men shoots at the officer before police arrest his accomplice. The man gives up the identity of the shooter. Twice, police stake out homes where they believe the shooter is hiding, but he eludes them.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, a series of crimes in a small Iowa farming community left residents reeling in shock and fear. Two young men went on a crime spree of robbery, kidnapping and murder, and then disappeared. By the time they were identified, they already had a twelve-hour lead. As the hunt for the two men expanded, the FBI committed its resources to tracking down the suspects. The pursuit would take agents across six states to catch the killers before they struck again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 90s, a gang based in the U.S. Virgin Islands began smuggling thousands of kilos of cocaine into mainland America. Police and federal agents target the gang, but its leader remains a mystery. In an investigation spanning from Georgia to South America, local police, the DEA, U.S. Customs and the FBI work together to take down this dangerous drug gang.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the mid-1990's, a gang of professional bank robbers raided cities across seven states. Disguises and speed protected their identity from cameras and the police as they stole hundreds of thousands of dollars, always leaving a bomb to terrorize their victims. The stakes were raised when the FBI discovered the robbers had an agenda beyond their personal wealth. To stop these extremists and their growing operation, the FBI needed to capture their leaders.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Alabama, a pair of convicted felons escaped the custody of a local deputy and fled across the country. Eluding authorities, they moved from state to state in a wave of abduction and car theft. When a foreign military officer disappeared along their trail, police and FBI agents wondered if the armed fugitives had become killers. Agents believed the pair were growing more violent and raced to find the escapees before more victims crossed their path.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In July 1996, two men entered a pawnshop in Birmingham, Alabama, and ruthlessly murdered the employees. Unbeknownst to the killers, a secret video surveillance camera recorded the shooting. Local police and the FBI released images of the crime to the media, and were quickly able to identify the perpetrators. Now authorities had to find two cold-blooded killers who knew that they were being pursued for murder one.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In January 1984, a U.S. Customs official disappears from his post near the Del Rio, Texas border crossing, prompting local police to search for four Latin American suspects driving a Pontiac Grand Prix. The following day, the Customs official was found dead. Two state troopers recovered the missing officer's service revolver after a fatal altercation with two men. Local police and the FBI continued searching for the suspect vehicle, prepared for a confrontation with desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the southwest one serial bank robber claimed his loot went to the poor, but this thief was no folk hero. He had a gun and was willing to shoot. The gunman was desperate to stay free, a threat to anyone in his way. The FBI and U.S. marshals teamed up to capture a resourceful criminal who proved he would never stop fighting.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In rural Texas, 13-year-old is kidnapped on her way to school. Frantic to find her safely, her millionaire father calls local authorities and the FBI. As police officers and agents conduct aerial surveillance, the father drives hundreds of miles through the night to deliver the ransom cash to a drop that the kidnappers keep changing. In a final effort to save the young girl, investigators must engage in a dangerous firefight with five desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A Labor Day weekend turned into a nightmare of murder as a cross-country crime spree terrorized the nation. In a small Ohio community, an elderly woman and a teenage boy disappeared within hours of each other. Police believed the cases were linked, but didn't know how. They contacted the FBI for help. A trail of stolen vehicles and murder victims across seven states led agents on a hunt for two suspected killers. Their only hope of stopping them was to anticipate the killers' next move.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Henderson, NV, a suburb of Las Vegas, two robbers brandishing assault rifles ambush armored guards as they exit their truck on March 3, 2000. The robbers kill both guards and seize $5,000. As the killers run to their getaway car, a police officer arrives and opens fire, striking one escaping assailant in the leg. After loosing the killers in a chase, police collect blood left by the injured robber and bullet casings from the firefight.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1980, extortionists plant a thousand pound bomb in a Nevada casino and demand millions of dollars, or they will detonate the device. The bomb is the largest explosive device the FBI has ever seen. Detonation would be a disaster. Agents and bomb experts must disarm the deadly device, and stop the dangerous extortionist who built it.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When violent criminals strike, the FBI strikes back, employing every available resource, and creating new ones when necessary. From forensic science to criminal profiling, specialized intelligence to global fugitive tracking, the agents of the FBI battle the bad guys with a most powerful arsenal: the crime-fighter's toolbox. This special episode of The FBI Files celebrates the groundbreaking science, investigative technique, and gut-level instinct that has made the FBI the world's premier law enforcement agency.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Langley, Virginia, a gunman fired into rush hour traffic. The brazen daytime shooting of employees from the Central Intelligence Agency stunned the country. The victims seemed randomly selected, but the motive appeared to be political. The FBI was called in, but the nationwide search quickly became a far-reaching international manhunt. Agents processed more than 2000 leads and crossed an ocean in the effort to deliver justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A day that began with a class field trip ended with a parent's worst nightmare. An 11-year-old girl was missing. Her parents were certain she was no runaway. When they failed to find her in their quiet Illinois neighborhood, they called the police. The FBI soon joined the investigation and family and friends worked with detectives and agents in an urgent search for the missing girl. Faced with conflicting witness reports and false leads, agents wouldn't stop until they found the girl, and the truth.
