programme.desc: Compelling mysteries, powerful documentaries, in-depth investigations.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensic scientists work with the only clue recovered from a multiple-victim shooting: a 12-gauge shotgun. Scientists use unique methods to lift the serial number from the weapon in order to trace it to its owner.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1999, a 12-year-old was found murdered in her home and it changed the feeling of security residents had in the small town of Waseca, Minnesota. Despite a meticulous search of the home and an exhaustive investigation, police had no suspects.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Native American woman was brutally killed in the desert of New Mexico, and the crime scene was rich in forensic evidence: tire tracks, shoe impressions and even the murder weapons.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man is found dead in his home, and his ex-wife has a perfect alibi. To determine time of death, investigators need to know when the victim ate his last meal. An endocrinologist, a forensic botanist, and a short-order cook answer their question.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Residents of Noel, Missouri were stunned to learn that their bank had been robbed and the bank president was missing. His body was later found floating in a lake, securely bound to a chair with duct tape.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man riding a bicycle was fatally injured, and police believed he was the victim of a hit-and-run accident. Tiny clues found at the scene created a picture of the vehicle which struck him and led police to its driver.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An examination of the first time animal DNA was used to solve a criminal case. When the body of Douglas Beamish's estranged wife Shirley Duguay was discovered, authorities linked 20 cat hairs found on her jacket to a cat owned by Beamish's parents.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of Philadelphia college athlete Aimee Willard is investigated after her car was found on the roadside. When her body is found, the police find unusual marks on her body and DNA evidence that eventually lead to her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Emergency dispatch received a call from a man who said his girlfriend shot and killed herself. The autopsy revealed that the gunshot wound was not self-inflicted and the evidence on her body would give police a golden opportunity to catch her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For years, a woman suffered from what appeared to be the unpleasant side effects of lithium, a drug prescribed to treat bipolar disorder. When she died, investigators had to determine if her death was due to natural causes, suicide, or murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The story of firefighter Michelle Baker is related. After meeting Dr. Maynard Muntzing, she became pregnant by him. After this news, she was ill whenever they were together. The coincidences led her to suspect that he was doing her harm.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A brilliant young architect became ill and died just before she was to testify in a criminal trial. The autopsy revealed she'd been poisoned with arsenic. Investigators had to determine which person who knew her had a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Firefighters found an entire family dead inside their home, it seemed like a murder-suicide. But there were several inconsistent clues in the rubble. Could ballistics, a time card, and some secret audiotapes unravel the mystery?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of a mail-order bride proves suspicious when detectives learn that two of the Texas husband's previous wives had died in mysterious circumstances.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When two women from the same town were murdered in the same way, police feared a serial killer was on the loose. At first they thought the victims had nothing in common until they found tiny clues linking them to the same man.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1986, Kathleen Lipscomb's body was found on a deserted road outside of San Antonio. Months passed, then years, and the crime was never solved. Then Kathleen's family hired a private investigator, who discovered her diary.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police instituted an intense search when the mother of two young children went missing. Twenty years after finding her body, advances in technology enable investigators to see evidence in a new light, and discover it pointed directly to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman suddenly becomes critically ill, eventually leaving her unable to walk. A bone marrow test reveals the cause: arsenic. Investigators must determine if the poisoning was caused by groundwater contamination or something more sinister.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police were puzzled by an obscure print found at a crime scene where one man had been killed and two teenage girls were seriously injured. Neither of the girls could identify their attacker. But one simple clue helped track the footsteps of a killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of a young woman was found under an isolated ramp of the Interstate, and a tiny, unique fiber on the victim's clothing led San Diego police straight to the most unlikely of killers.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A behavioral profile caused the Baton Rouge Police Department to search for the wrong man. They might not have made an arrest had it not been for a DNA picture of the suspect painted by a molecular biologist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman's death in Pennsylvania triggers a homicide investigation into another woman's death in North Carolina. The similarities in the cases were striking, and examiners must determine if the suspect's story about accidental drowning is all wet.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Time of death becomes pivotal after a pregnant woman is found murdered in her air-conditioned bedroom. A striking similarity between her death and an HBO movie gives examiners the clues they need to thaw out the alibi of a cold-blooded killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1962, the people of the small town of Hanford, California lost their sense of peace when one of their own, 15-year-old Marlene Miller, was murdered.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: At a murder scene, investigators find a shoe-print, several foreign hairs, and unknown fingerprints. But they believe the most telling piece of evidence is the bite mark on the victim's chest.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In Pennsylvania 1984, a passer-by finds the torso of a woman in a cardboard box. Investigators rely on insect activity analysis by a forensic entomologist to determine when the murder victim was killed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a victim is brutally murdered in his own bed, investigators find a shoe impression in the mud outside--physical evidence they hope will lead to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murders of an elderly couple leave police stumped until, two years later, they receive a major break. A jeweler looking through old newspaper clippings recognizes a necklace the female victim wore as having been pawned in her own shop.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How scientists solved a 1992 murder case involving cremation. It takes a long time and a very hot fire to cremate a human body, and thus destroy evidence of foul play. But the coroner who performed the autopsy on the body found telltale clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mother of two young children was found dead in her bedroom. Her death was ruled a suicide _ but when investigators learned she had almost died in a house fire three years earlier, they decided to take another look at the evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Armed with little else, police hoped the shoe impressions found at a Lansing, Michigan crime scene would put their investigation of Audrey Nichols' murder back on track.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three homicides on two continents looked like professional executions. Investigators on both sides of the Atlantic needed to find out if they were related and, if they were, who or what they had in common.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 29-year-old woman was killed instantly when a bomb exploded in her home. The device was so powerful that shrapnel was embedded in houses across the street. The bomber had not only knowledge and skill, but also a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A high school gym teacher mysteriously left town, without saying goodbye to anyone. He later sent letters to explain why. But a closer forensic look at those letters, and a microscopic piece of tissue, gave investigators an entirely different explanation for where he went and why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An employee of a dry cleaner was raped and murdered in the store. Police turned to forensic science for the answers they needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A healthy young man dies mysteriously in his sleep, and toxicology tests reveal a lethal dose of lidocaine in his blood. Investigators find a suicide note, and presume he killed himself until a forensic linguist examines the note.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A talented television news anchor was shot to death outside her home; it appeared to be a crime of passion, perpetrated by an obsessed fan.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A fire erupted in Kings Cross Station in London, killing 31 people and injuring dozens more. Investigators pinpointed the cause of the fire, but it took state-of-the-art technology and fluid dynamics experts to explain why it became a deadly inferno.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A drive-by shooting leaves one man dead and another seriously wounded. Cell phone calls and shell casings point to a suspect, but authorities are unable to place him at the crime scene. A forensic geologist proves that dirt is anything but dumb.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 3-year-old son of parents in Dripping Springs, Texas develops a respiratory condition. Then the father develops signs of Alzheimer's disease, and an investigator reveals that their ill health is due to a form of black mold in their modern home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a 6-year-old disappears, her father becomes the prime suspect; he fails a polygraph test and even confesses, but 10 years later, the investigation gets turned on its head.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A patrol officer is shocked by the amount of blood at a traffic accident and is shocked by the coroner's ruling until an anonymous phone call re-ignites the case.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman disappears without a trace. Even though foul play is suspected, the leads don't pan out and the trail turns cold. Twenty years would pass before police are able to link a clump of hair discovered in an isolated area with the missing woman.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Just weeks before a witness is to testify against the man accused of sexually assaulting her, she is murdered in the front yard of her own home. Investigators immediately suspect her attacker, but they don't have enough evidence to prove his guilt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man disappears one year to the day after beginning an affair with his friend's wife. 15 years later, with the help of a metal detector, police found evidence which would prove what had happened, and who was responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Authorities track a kidnapper who allowed his victim, 17-year-old Shari Smith, to write a last will and testament on a note pad, then informed the family of her murder, as well as the later murder of a 10-year-old Debra May Helmick. A phone number written on a previous page left a lasting impression, which helped to convict Larry Gene Bell.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 19-year-old woman was found dead in her car; the scene had been staged to make murder appear to be suicide. During their investigation, police discovered the victim was involved in a love quadrangle, giving several people a motive to kill her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a pipe bomb ripped through a rural home, police had no idea who was responsible. A lot number on a 9-volt battery and the remnants of a mailing label found on a hard drive led investigators to who sent the bomb and why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation of a discarded sleeping bag, containing bloody sneakers and a purse, leads police to the body of a young woman. A mark found on the victim's body would enable police to track the killer, Jesse Pratt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teen was killed by her parents in what they said was self-defense, but forensic evidence told otherwise.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A serial arsonist was on the loose in Washington, DC. Each of the fires was started with the same type of incendiary device. It was up to forensic scientists to find the clues that lay in the ashes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Rosemary Anderson is found dead on the side of the road, her boyfriend becomes the prime suspect. He eventually confessed to her murder, but so did another man _ serial killer, Eric Edgar Cooke.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Using an anonymous letter and geographical profiling, investigators close in on a serial rapist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two eyewitnesses may hold the key to the death of a motorcycle gang member.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police officer accused of killing his estranged wife insists she committed suicide. Investigators say it was murder¾_ that it was physically impossible for the woman to have shot herself.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Rosemary Anderson is found dead on the side of the road, her boyfriend becomes the prime suspect. He eventually confessed to her murder, but so did another man _ serial killer, Eric Edgar Cooke.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The story of firefighter Michelle Baker is related. After meeting Dr. Maynard Muntzing, she became pregnant by him. After this news, she was ill whenever they were together. The coincidences led her to suspect that he was doing her harm.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An investigation into the murder of Katie Poirier is stymied by the lack of a body, but they find a few charred remains including a tooth. The tooth's filling contains unique properties that help investigators identify her remains. Further forensic evidence is then used to convict Donald Blom of her murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A college student was found dead, and the evidence suggested he knew his killer. Three hairs and some microscopic cells helped police to unravel a web of lies, and find the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a victim is brutally murdered in his own bed, investigators find a shoe impression in the mud outside--physical evidence they hope will lead to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young couple decided to celebrate their first wedding anniversary with a camping trip to Mount Hood. During the trip, the husband was shot and killed, and his wife told two different versions of the events which led to his death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: 1984 Rajneeshee bioterror attack: investigators uncover a plot to overthrow the government after a unique strain of salmonella makes people ill.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How scientists solved a 1992 murder case involving cremation. It takes a long time and a very hot fire to cremate a human body, and thus destroy evidence of foul play. But the coroner who performed the autopsy on the body found telltale clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two eyewitnesses may hold the key to the death of a motorcycle gang member.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Investigators sift through the ashes of a fire which killed a 40-year-old woman. The fire appeared to have been started by an unattended cigarette. On closer look, forensic scientists discover the cause was far more complicated.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: No one in a quiet residential community saw anything unusual the day one of their neighbors was brutally attacked and murdered. Fingerprints found at the crime scene and surveillance video helped investigators to apprehend the presumed killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A killer tried to incinerate and destroy everything that could link him to his crime. But in doing so, he inadvertently created new forensic evidence, evidence which came to light with a technique never before used in a criminal investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Modesto, California teenager went missing. There was no sign of a struggle in her home, and police suspected she'd simply run away until her naked, bruised body was discovered in a ditch 20 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man tells police he shot an intruder who had attacked and murdered his wife. The husband paints a tragic picture and is dubbed a hero. Four years later, forensic evidence leads police to re-examine the motives of this so-called hero.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The wife of an Air Force officer was found dead in her bed with a plastic laundry bag near her face. Further investigation proved that the scene had been staged. Her death wasn't an accident; it was cold-blooded murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman was found dead on a golf course in the Bahamas. The grass on that course was so distinctive, it had evidentiary value. The evidence led police to two suspects. Each blamed the other, and they had to find out who the killer was.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 19-year-old woman was found dead in her car; the scene had been staged to make murder appear to be suicide. During their investigation, police discovered the victim was involved in a love quadrangle, giving several people a motive to kill her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A fire erupted in Kings Cross Station in London, killing 31 people and injuring dozens more. Investigators pinpointed the cause of the fire, but it took state-of-the-art technology and fluid dynamics experts to explain why it became a deadly inferno.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of an American tourist in a Mexican resort focused law enforcement resources on both sides of the border. At first glance, the motive appeared to be robbery, but careful analysis of the forensic evidence pointed to something more sinister.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is found dead in a ravine, but crucial crime scene evidence had been washed away by severe thunderstorms. Twice, the trail turned cold. Almost 20 years later, an old hat and a chip of stainless steel brought the killer to justice.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation of a discarded sleeping bag, containing bloody sneakers and a purse, leads police to the body of a young woman. A mark found on the victim's body would enable police to track the killer, Jesse Pratt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Time of death becomes pivotal after a pregnant woman is found murdered in her air-conditioned bedroom. A striking similarity between her death and an HBO movie gives examiners the clues they need to thaw out the alibi of a cold-blooded killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teen was killed by her parents in what they said was self-defense, but forensic evidence told otherwise.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A look back at a trio of unsolved murders that occurred in Wichita Falls, Texas during the 1980s, details how a fourth murder from the same time period provided the police with more than they realized.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Armed with little else, police hoped the shoe impressions found at a Lansing, Michigan crime scene would put their investigation of Audrey Nichols' murder back on track.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An obstetrician returned home from the hospital and found his wife on the bathroom floor. She was covered with blood and not breathing. He tried unsuccessfully to revive her, staining his clothes with her blood in the process, and then he called 911.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman suddenly becomes critically ill, eventually leaving her unable to walk. A bone marrow test reveals the cause: arsenic. Investigators must determine if the poisoning was caused by groundwater contamination or something more sinister.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When two women from the same town were murdered in the same way, police feared a serial killer was on the loose. At first they thought the victims had nothing in common until they found tiny clues linking them to the same man.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Hikers near Anchorage, Alaska discovered a body wrapped in sheets which were edged in orange stitching. Clinging to the sheet, they also discovered a tuft of red carpet fibers _ threads of evidence which led them straight to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a popular disc jockey was found murdered in a community garden, police swung into action. A sniffer dog and a blood spatter expert led police to the killer and he'd been much closer than they realized.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1987 disappearance of Houston resident Tracy Jo Shine is recalled. The investigation went cold until 2000 when a 'cold case squad' learned that the woman's ex-boyfriend Michael Neal had bragged about killing her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1996 investigation into 48-year-old Martha Hansen's murder in Anchorage is helped by a legal requirement that bars have video cameras installed on the premises. Using video, hair and blood evidence, investigators determine that Evans Lee Curtis was the murderer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1984, California firefighters had battled ten arson fires in three weeks. When cigarettes and a scrap of paper connected the southern California fires to several fires further north, the hunt was on for a dangerous pyromaniac.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A murder investigation in St. Petersburg, Florida, crosses jurisdictions from New York and Jamaica. The police rely on cell phone mapping, wiretapping and a host of forensic evidence to link a suspect to a murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of an eccentric millionaire was not entirely unexpected; he flaunted his wealth and cared little for personal security. The evidence at the crime seemed to indicate robbery, but investigators wondered if there was something more.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When police recovered the submerged car of a man reported missing, they expected to find his body _ but it wasn't there. The investigation which followed would uncover an obsession turned deadly, and the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Native American woman was brutally killed in the desert of New Mexico, and the crime scene was rich in forensic evidence: tire tracks, shoe impressions and even the murder weapons.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young woman disappeared, police feared she was the latest victim in a string of similar crimes. A pair of bloody gloves, unique tire tracks, and ordinary grass and pine needles provided investigators with some extraordinary clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is killed while walking her dogs in the woods. Since she had no enemies and her husband has an alibi, police assume it was a hunting accident...until a strange letter turns up allegedly written by the woman before her death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Haunted by the disappearance of her mother, a young woman undertook an investigation of her own. Her mother's diary was in the cold case file; there, she discovered a dark family secret, which might have been the reason her mother vanished.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police instituted an intense search when the mother of two young children went missing. Twenty years after finding her body, advances in technology enable investigators to see evidence in a new light, and discover it pointed directly to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1996 Seattle murder of suburban couple Raquel Rivera & Jay Johnson is detailed. Evidence from the couple's dog Chief eventually ties one of the murderers to the scene. This is one of the first cases where dog DNA was used to convict.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young TV news producer is raped and murdered in her apartment. Police identify two suspects, but both are cleared of any wrongdoing. The case stalls for more than a year, and then investigators turn to the Commonwealth of Virginia's DNA Databank.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An Alaskan police officer found a woman's body while on routine patrol of a public park. The victim had been stabbed to death and, during the autopsy, the medical examiner preserved the portion of her rib cage which sustained the fatal wound.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: With no forensic evidence inside a murder scene, investigators were baffled. But they suspected that the victim's dog had witnessed the crime. If she had, forensic scientists would have to find a way to find out what the dog had seen.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Emergency dispatch received a call from a man who said his girlfriend shot and killed herself. The autopsy revealed that the gunshot wound was not self-inflicted and the evidence on her body would give police a golden opportunity to catch her killer.

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: Cheer as consumer complaints lead to a fraud bust, then unmask a kidnapper.

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: Listen as a tip breaks a huge food fraud case, then sniff out an insurance scam.

programme.title: Poisonous Liaisons
programme.desc: Investigate murders done by injection and the pinpricks that gave a killer away.

programme.title: Poisonous Liaisons
programme.desc: Uncover some lethal chemical cocktails delivered by wives who wanted out.

programme.title: Poisonous Liaisons
programme.desc: Watch hubris bring down poisoners who thought they were smarter than the police.

programme.title: Big Little Crimes

programme.desc: Hosted by Bloomberg Global Finance Correspondent Sonali Basak, Bullish is an immersive journey through the high-stakes world of finance as seen by its titans and rising stars.

programme.title: LEADERS with Francine Lacqua:Alexander Stubb, President of Finland
programme.desc: What drives the world’s most influential minds? In Leaders with Francine Lacqua, Bloomberg’s award-winning anchor sits down with the decision-makers shaping our future to explore the personal stories behind their public personas. Discover what inspires them, how they navigate power and the lessons they offer on defining success. Insightful, cinematic and elegantly crafted, Leaders goes beyond the headlines to reveal the human side of leadership.

programme.title: Bloomberg Investigates:Night of Terror

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: A taekwondo master on a mission to empower women, a high school football star making his family proud, and a soccer club smashing stereotypes personify the best of Sacramento.

programme.title: One Pill Can Kill
programme.desc: Told through the voices of grieving parents, this documentary follows the real and lasting impact of the fentanyl crisis. Capturing the aftermath of sudden loss, the search for answers, and the transformation of grief into public advocacy.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.desc: With a lump of clay and a vision, Manchester ceramics artist Monica Leap empowers and builds community connections through pottery.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Witness extreme car chases captured on video, from fleeing via fire truck to off-roading into a corn field. Fortunately no one is seriously hurt – except, at times, the vehicles.

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented “for the picking.” From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Three brutal cold cases remain unsolved for decades until advances in forensic technology bring investigators closer than ever to finding answers for the victims’ families and friends.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Years ago Chef Bergen Carmen from Meril and Chef Aaron Villeda from Bao Mi worked side-by-side; now they’re back getting their hands dirty for some friendly competition. Will his old pal chicken liver turn out to be Chef Villeda’s ultimate downfall?

programme.title: Breaking Bread
programme.desc: What happens when you put an award-winning chef in a hospital kitchen? We’ll explore food’s incredible healing power. Then, at a Sacramento rice farm, chefs and friends gather to demonstrate first-hand the farm-to-fork culture of the region.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Where can you find a book about choosing weird, a torch-wielding craftswoman, and a family bakery burning the midnight oil? The same place where alleyways have meaningful names and the American River changed the course of triathlons.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Maddy & Dixie are always looking for that next new thing. Join them as they explore a few of Sactown's surprising offerings, from mobile archery to an intimate cocktail bar with over 700 bottles of unique liquor.

programme.title: Ora 4X
programme.desc: Two patients. One life-changing choice. With a wedding fast approaching, Nicole’s racing to restore her smile. After years of struggle, Jared’s reclaiming his life and his confidence. Watch how Ora 4X transforms futures, one smile at a time.

programme.title: Breaking Bread
programme.desc: What happens when you put an award-winning chef in a hospital kitchen? We’ll explore food’s incredible healing power. Then, at a Sacramento rice farm, chefs and friends gather to demonstrate first-hand the farm-to-fork culture of the region.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Skip the drive-through! Chefs Ericka Loyal and Josh Vecchiolla are finessing their favorite classic fast food dishes. Which chef's spin will win the judges over?

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Maddy & Dixie seek out Sacramento locals who are trend setting and pushing the limits in the original & inventive ways they do business.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From a car crashing into a home to a lemur fleeing a DUI scene, these captivating real-life stories explore intense arrests caught on film.

programme.title: Mo Gaba: Spirit Lives Forever
programme.desc: How a child living with cancer changed the Baltimore sports community forever.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Celebrating veterans, acknowledging their service and sacrifices

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminal’s and a casino magnate’s family forever.

programme.title: Shift: The Ragbrai Documentary
programme.desc: A celebration of the oldest, largest, and longest recreational touring bicycle ride in the world. Three riders and a pair of community leaders reach new personal heights, changing their lives along the seven day ride across Iowa.

programme.title: The Lost Children of Carlisle
programme.desc: A powerful look at the history of Native American boarding schools as told through the stories of tribal members and their surviving family members, who endured an educational system founded on the concept “Kill the Indian in him, and save the man.”

programme.title: Easy Money: Fraud, Fortune and Failures
programme.desc: (2021) With nearly 15 hours of interviews from 17 people – and dozens of hours of news footage — Easy Money tells the story of what is being called the worst fraud in California history.

programme.title: Always Remember Your Name
programme.desc: A documentary of mistaken identity, hope, love, and the power of story by two Holocaust survivors.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes exploiting online generosity are a growing trend. These real-life stories show people going to great lengths to con unsuspecting donors out of their money.

programme.title: California Politics 360
programme.desc: KCRA 3's Political Director Ashley Zavala speaks with Border Patrol Chief for the El Centro Sector Gregory Bovino in a one-on-one interview about recent immigration raids.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Glenda Macatangay has conquered her career and being a single mom to four kids. But when it comes to being comfortable in the outdoors, she isn’t as confident. Kinga meets up with Glenda in Sacramento, CA to introduce her to the wonders of the wilderness.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Dedicated mom and nurse, Cleo, spends a day filled with surprises. This incredible mother has overcome obstacles no parent should have to face. Cleo and her sons cook up some quality time.

programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented “for the picking.” From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: In this game show, comedian Frank Nicotero hits the streets to ask people questions inspired by the wildest news stories for a chance at winning a cash prize. These real-life stories with unreal outcomes will make you say, “Wait, What Happened?"

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Makers, crafters and artists square off to create the most iconic art piece that best represents their city. From glass-blowers and chalk artists to metalsmiths and tattooers, see who Host Ashley Adams and the judges will crown the victor.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: Lowrider Legacy
programme.desc: Lowrider Legacy follows celebrated lowrider families, scholars, and activists and documents the history of resistance on wheels that has defined lowrider culture.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Maddy & Dixie are always looking for that next new thing. Join them as they explore a few of Sactown's surprising offerings, from mobile archery to an intimate cocktail bar with over 700 bottles of unique liquor.

programme.title: KCRA Local News

programme.desc: Game On: Fight for the Kings is a KCRA 3 documentary with never-before-heard stories of the four-month fight, the friendships garnered between the rival cities, and Sacramento doing the unimaginable: winning the battle for the Kings.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Witness extreme car chases captured on video, from fleeing via fire truck to off-roading into a corn field. Fortunately no one is seriously hurt – except, at times, the vehicles.

programme.title: Breaking Bread
programme.desc: What happens when you put an award-winning chef in a hospital kitchen? We’ll explore food’s incredible healing power. Then, at a Sacramento rice farm, chefs and friends gather to demonstrate first-hand the farm-to-fork culture of the region.

programme.title: The Roller Coaster Wars That Birthed a Beast
programme.desc: In 2006, two dozen roller coaster riders landed in the hospital after a freak malfunction in Ohio. This is the story of Kings Island: how its thrilling – and sometimes nail-biting – history spawned one of America’s greatest amusement parks.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In a serene community, a beloved doctor is bludgeoned in her own home. Investigators uncover a conspiracy that rocks the close-knit neighborhood to its core​​.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Stitch showcases the feel-good and do-good that make up the fabric of America from inspiring tales of perseverance, to good Samaritans helping neighbors, to trailblazers improving their communities.

programme.title: Neighbors Helping Neighbors at the Maryland Food Bank
programme.desc: The Maryland Food Bank is fighting hunger with innovation, farms, mobile markets, culinary training, and volunteers—proving what’s possible when communities come together.
